fields.description:
The string "Please restart your server so that all necessary changes can take affect. " is wrong, should be

"Please restart your server so that all necessary changes can take effect. "
fields.summary: String "can take affect" should be "can take effect"

fields.description:
# Load blankinstance.xml (or similar)
# JQL: assignee = fred
# save as new filter
# delete fred
# load saved filter
# you cannot click on Filter: View and there is no Summary. I would expect a Summary of "JQL Query: assignee = fred" (since the query does not fit)
fields.summary: no summary when loaded invalidated assignee/reporter filters

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:

* Create a Select custom field with a global context with drop down options: *Apples, Oranges*
* Create an issue in project A set to *Apples*.
* Modify the custom field context so that only *Oranges* apply to project A.
* Create a new custom field context for project A with new options: *Kangeroos, Zebras*
* If you view the original issue again, you'll see that *Apples* is displayed even though only *Kangeroos, Zebras* are the only valid values.  This generates further confusion for the user when they realize that:
** Searching by custom field for *Apples* doesn't produce the issue in the results.
** Editing the issue will simply reset the custom field to blank/empty.  

It would be less confusing to not show anything at all for the custom field if this was the case.
fields.summary: View Issue screen does not observe custom field context rules

fields.description:
In section "Troubleshooting Instructions" on page http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAEXT/JIRA+Subversion+Plugin

I lost a lot of time getting this plugin to work due to lack of experience. Additional documentation in the above section would have helped. I configured the plugin to link to the Atlassian test site. The plugin did not work and threw errors into the log (every hour). The documentation suggests browsing to the Atlassian test site but I now realize this only confirms that the browser is configured to pass the company firewall and the Atlassian test site is operational. However, the plugin is not using the browser, it is using the application server (Tomcat for me) to try to access the web. Therefore Tomcat must be configured to pass the firewall, but how took me a long time to discover. Solution: In startup.bat add the following parameters to the SET JAVA_OPTS= command:

    -Dhttp.proxyHost=your-proxy-address -Dhttp.proxyPort=80

Note: When creating an issue with Atlassian, there is no "Severity of Problem" option for a documentation change. Also, the " Customer Timezone" option does not allow for Adelaide, South Australia which is +9:30.
fields.summary: Add firewall instructions to the JIRA Subversion Plugin documentation

fields.description:
Now that we have been using Jira as part of our support system, we have noticed an issue where new users created by the email handler are polluting our user list drop down boxes.  It would be nice if we could specify the group to create the new user in directly in the email handler configuration section so that we don't have to manually edit the group membership later.  We do not allow the users created via the email handler to login directly to Jira but we still want their email address and name.  As it stands we are having the users created in the Jira-Users group (as per the default behavior) and another group which does not have a permission scheme associated with it.  Then we manually remove the user from the Jira-Users group and since there are no permissions associated to the other group, the user cannot assign any issues and therefore does not show up in any of the user drop down box lists.

Is there any easier way of doing this or is there some automation step that we are missing?  We have already customized some of the email handler code to tailor the response emails to our needs but I would rather stay away from any code changes.
fields.summary: Abillity To Specify Group For User Created By Email Handler

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17958].
  {panel}

Hi,
When deleting a user a screen displays user statistics (see first first attachement).
It would be great if we could access this information from a link in the user management screen? This will enhance and ease a lot user administration..
Thank you,
Kais
fields.summary: Display user statistics as a link in the user management screen

fields.description: It seems that the before-field for a date searcher works exclusive, thus to find all issues due on or before {{13/Jul/09}} one would have to enter {{13/Jul/09}}. This is *not* what the tooltip says.
fields.summary: Before-date searchers works exclusive as opposed to what tooltip says.
Upgrade licensing framework to version 2

fields.description:
Given the JQL:

* resolutiondate <= "-1h"

Switch to Filter: View. The Summary field is empty. It should have something there.

This is also true if you fill out the corresponding form in basic edit mode.

All date range fields seem to have the same problem.

TestSimpleAdvancedView.java will need to be updated once this has been fixed.
fields.summary: no summary under filter view

fields.description:
For example, "very-long" maps to TEXT on postgres (ie - CLOB), but it maps to VARCHAR2(4000) on Oracle.

This means if you take a JIRA export from postgres, you may not be able to import it into Oracle as some columns may contain too much data.
eg SearchRequest.description.
fields.summary: Different definitions for entity field type "very-long" for different DB systems causes DB incompatibilities, and therefore errors on import.

fields.description:
If you enter the following JQL query:

* status in (1,4)

and then go to the summary for the filter it'll display

* Status: Open and Resolved

That "and" sort of makes sense coming from the legacy forms (where it means something like "issues where Status is Open AND issues where Status is Resolved") but now that JQL has introduced a new notion of boolean to people searching it is confusing. We should be displaying "Open or Resolved" in the summary.

This no doubt affects things besides just Status so we need to fix all of those places. And all the func tests that are going to be broken by this.
fields.summary: confusing use of booleans in filter summary

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login as admin and create custom field having special characters like <,> and *
2. Add the custom fields to default screen
3. Try to use custom field in JQL query using autocomplete

Result:
1. In the auto complete drop down the characters are shown differently.
2. Once selected they appear fine in query box.

Expected:
1. The auto complete box show the characters properly.
fields.summary: JQL: Custom fields having special charcaters like <> * are not getting displayed properly in JQL autocomplete

fields.description:
Steps:
1. In the documentation the example we have given for Unreleasedversions/ releasedversions give feeling that project name is a required parameter. I will file a separate issue to rectify that.
2. Create a query like project=JIRA and fixVersion in releasedversions(JIRA) and try to click on "Simple"

Result:
1. User get an error "Query is too complex to display in the Issue Navigator edit controls."
2. Just delete the project name from the function and user can see the query in simple view.

Expected:
1. We should be supporting queries like these in simple view. As user can easily create query like above in simple view.
2. Giving error message about complex query is only going to confuse user.
fields.summary: JQL: Query having project and Unreleasedversions/ releasedversions(with project name) function can't viewed in simple view.

fields.description:
The message you receive when you can't delete an issue type is this (refer to JRA-17949 for steps to reproduce):
bq. In order for an issue type to be deleted, it needs to be associated with one workflow, field configuration and field screen scheme across all projects. If this is not the case, JIRA can not provide a list of valid replacement issue types.

This did not make much sense to me on first viewing, and I'm a JIRA developer. I tried to look for more information in the docs, but nothing seemed to touch on it.

This screen could definitely benefit from a help link or more information explaining why exactly the issue type cannot be deleted, and what the situation would need to be for it to be possible.
fields.summary: Instructions for deleting an issue type are too vague, and docs do not further explain them

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create 2 projects
# Create 2 field configuration schemes and assign one to each project
# Create 2 field configurations and assign one to be the default (ie no issue type) of each field configuration scheme
# Create a Bug issue in one project
# Try to delete "Bug" issue type (not migrate)

You get this message:
{quote}Note: This issue type cannot be deleted - there are currently 1 matching issues with no suitable alernative issue types (only issues you have permission to see will be displayed, which may be different from the total count shown on this page).

In order for an issue type to be deleted, it needs to be associated with one workflow, field configuration and field screen scheme across all projects. If this is not the case, JIRA can not provide a list of valid replacement issue types.{quote}

It seems that this is a bug, because within each project, there is no distinction between "Bug" and any other issue type, so they should be interchangeable.
fields.summary: Unable to delete issue type despite alternatives for swapping being available

fields.description:
Try and run the JQL {{comment~"abc is a very good day" and summary ~ "ぎ[ざちぢにひぬほ"}}

You will get an error message like: Unable to parse the text 'ぎ[ざちぢにひぬほ' for field 'summary'.

# We need to indicate what the syntax is for the text fields (maybe a link)?
# Is it possible to indicate what the error is?
# It is not clear who is causing the parse error, is it JQL or is it Lucene. May not be important for the user.
fields.summary: Bad Error Message when Lucene cannot parse lucene query from the summary field.

Query performed as anonymous user

fields.description:

3. The JQL queries get saved in history drop down.

fields.description:
This query is written as anonymous user
Steps:
1. Launch JIRA.
2. Suppose user wants to write a query like ((issuetype in (bug, "High priority feature", Improvement) or project="Browse Project" )) and ((reporter = veenu) and (assignee =veenu))
3. After closing the first set of query using )), try to use auto complete.

Result:
1. Auto complete for JQL stop working for further query once the query statement has double closing parenthesis.
2. In the above example ((issuetype in (bug, "High priority feature", Improvement) or project="Browse Project" )), user will not able to use autocomplete.

Expected:
1. User should be able to use Auto complete.
fields.summary: JQL: Auto complete does n't work if query contains nested parenthesis

4. Executed query related to project and issue type and subtask.
 
Result:

2. Later there was memory eror in tomcat window.
3. Last query execute was issue type and Auto complete for it suddenly stop working. 
4. Log file attached.

Expected :

fields.description: Can we have that back please?  :)

fields.description: We would like a standard field type that will allow us to create custom drop down lists and selection lists from our enterprise databases. The community developed plug-in causes an error when reordering any custom field and we do not want to move the plug-in to production.
fields.summary: Database drop down list or selection list field type without plug-in

fields.description:
There should be the ability to manually change the status - DevTrack had this as a "PowerEdit" and it made perfect sense.

There are many times where I need to move an issue from one status to another, and I DON'T want to have to create a workflow transition for every conceiveable status to status change, thereby pollutting my workflow. These are by definition outlying conditions that need to be handled.

For instance - I have a defect right now that's in QA review. The customer just happened to make a comment about it that makes me realize that the defect was improperly dealt with. I want to take it back to the Customer Information Needed step -but there's no path to do this from QA Review. Of course not - because this kind of thing rarely happens.

Now - you expect me to create a transition for every conceivable path like this?

I'm telling you - the DevTrack feature for Power Edit was very nice.
fields.summary: Ability to change the status, and bulk change the status, of an issue (DevTrack has this)

fields.description:
The List of screens seen in the Admin "View Screens" (/secure/admin/ViewFieldScreens.jspa) page orders the Screens alphabetically by name.
However, if you add a new Screen, it will always appear at the bottom of the list.
The sorting is only done when the cache of Screens first loads, or is completely refreshed.
fields.summary: Newly created "FieldScreen" objects are not viewed in alphabetical order until there is a system restart.

e.g. [Search for ＪＩＲＡ|http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/QuickSearch.jspa?searchString=jra%20%EF%BC%AA%EF%BC%A9%EF%BC%B2%EF%BC%A1]

fields.description:
Steps:

# Make a filter (let's say you want to see all the bugs that are Resolved - Fixed). We will assume that you configured Jira to display 50 records per page and the results set have 51 records. This means that you will have 2 pages with only one items being displayed on 2nd page.
# Go to 2nd page, open the bug, and change its status (or Resolution) so that the bug will be excluded in from the filter you previously made. 
# Click on Find Issues tab (this will redirect you to the search issues page with the last filtered applied)

The page will now show 0 of X results. 

We should probably validate that the start index passed will actually include results and go back to the previous page if not.
fields.summary: Issue navigator shows 0 results for filter when you view the last page and then update issues so that the last page will no longer have any results

fields.description:
When an anonymous user  tries to navigate to an existing issue in JIRA, (s)he might be presented with the following message:

{quote}
Login Required
You are not logged in.

You cannot view this URL as a guest. You must login or signup for an account .

If you think this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 
{quote}

This page should be eliminated. The user should be sent directly to the login page, with the "you are required to log in" message displayed.
fields.summary: Handle in better way issue view permission violation

fields.description:
# Enter the JQL query, "ORDER BY issuekey".
# Click the key column to re-order.
# The JQL query now says "ORDER BY key"

Since JQL tries to hard to preseve the original query in other cases it seems strange that this one gets rewritten. Since it works as-is today this is currently maked as a trivial bug.

Most likely this means revisiting the merge query code yet again.
fields.summary: JQL rewrite to JQL name when clicking on columns in advanced view
Review Gadget browser preview images

fields.description:
The HelpUtil class may not produce valid URL. When you specify a fragment it must be placed after the query string. For example, HelpUtil produces the URL {{http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-040/Advanced+Searching#AdvancedSearching-JQLreservedwords?clicked=jirahelp}} but it should actually be {{http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-040/Advanced+Searching?clicked=jirahelp#AdvancedSearching-JQLreservedwords}}. The bad URL still redirects you to the page, just not the right section of it.

This is caused by us using properties like {{Searching+for+Issues#SearchingforIssues-workratio}} in our {{help-paths.properties}} to redirect towards a fragment. We need to allow people to specify fragments as another property (e.g. *.target) or maybe even parse out of the "URL".
fields.summary: Help Paths Does not produce valid URLS.

fields.description:
Execute the following jql query: 
affectedVersion is empty order by key

Now execute this jql query:
affectedVersion empty order by key

An error message will appear and tell you that the query wasn't parseable.
But the jql suddenly contains the order by statement appenden to the end, and looks like this:
affectedVersion empty order by key ORDER BY key
fields.summary: JQL: Unparsable query repeats order by statement

fields.description:
Import the data of func test: TestSearchConstrainedByConfiguration. (TestSearchConstrainedByConfiguration.xml)

Run the jql query: affectedVersion is not empty.
The results contain issue:  INI-1, which does have an empty version (field is not visible). I set the field to visible and the query still returned this issue.

Only by adding versions to the Invisible Project and changing the affectedVersion of the issue to the new version and then back to unknown, the search continues to work properly and the jql query "affectedVersion is not empty" will not return INI-1 anymore.
fields.summary: JQL: "affectedVersion is not empty" returns issue with empty affected version.

I use the hotkeys all the time. When viewing a particular issue from a filtered list of issue, the hotkey for returning "Return to search" doesn't work. I know the rollover says "ALT + F" but in OS X this appears to always be CTRL whether in FF or Safari.

The other hotkeys like Next and Previous issue work fine.

Deleting Custom Field Contexts does not remove options from database

fields.description:
# Restore the attached test.xml
# login as admin
# execute jql query: ORDER BY NF
# notice that the result orders both NF custom fields in ascending order and both have arrows. It has been decided that we'll leave that as it is.
# Click the column heading for the second NF field to make it sort DESC.
# notice that the query has been changed to: "ORDER BY cf[10005] DESC, NF". technicallyl this means that cf[10005] is listed twice since it is also part of NF.
# go to View Filter: the summary says "Sorted by:  NF descending, then NF ascending, then NF ascending" which isn't correct.
# click Edit Filter: *now* you get an error message saying that query is invalid.

We shouldn't generate invalid queries from a user clicking on the column headings.
fields.summary: ordering by multiple CFs with same name result in generating invalid JQL

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Disable sub tasks
# Save the search {{parent = 'HSP-1'}} (where HSP-1 actually exists)
# Create a 2D Stats Portlet that is backed by this filter (with totals shown)
# The filter should return no results on its own, but the stats portlet will display the wrong total counts

The code in the LuceneSearchProvider#search() interprets the false result as the MatchAllDocsQuery, even though it should just return nothing.
fields.summary: Single clause that generates false result actually returns all issues

fields.description:
Currently 'Filter Statistics' portlet is not presenting these rows that have 0 (zero) count. 
It should be at least configurable.
fields.summary: Filter statistics portlet to show rows with zero count

fields.description:
In http://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/rpc-jira-plugin/latest/com/atlassian/jira/rpc/soap/JiraSoapService.html there is a function to create/update a project and set some scheme (perms, notification, issue security), but not the enterprise scheme like the workflow, issue type and fields configuration schemes.

This would improve considerably bulk operations required when I have to create a new workflow on a new issue type that would affect the main workflow scheme.
At the moment, creating the workflow and issue type is simple, but to activate this change, I cannot simply edit the active workflow scheme and I have to copy that scheme to a new scheme, add the mapping and then update the 200+ projects manually in the web application to use the new scheme (which takes a considerable amount of time). 

Using the SOAP interface would have been great, but this ability seems to be missing.
Apologies if this feature was already requested, I looked for it in the database, but couldn't find anything similar.
fields.summary: Add Ability to set workflow scheme with SOAP

fields.description:
Hi.
We use Jira 3.10.1 and we have noticed, that if add the atlassian-mail.properties file with mail.debug=true property, the JavaMail library uses the STDOUT to output the debug information, not log4j functionality. It is not comfortable, as we need to restart the application every time we want to turn On or Off the mail logging. This creates inconvenience to our business users.
Could you modify Jira components (like a MailFetcherService, etc.) to use the JavaMail with logging via log4j?
Thanks.
fields.summary: Modify MailFetcherService and other related to JavaMail components to use the log4j for debug output
Creating users from email could lead to "java.lang.RuntimeException: Found more than one user with name 'XXXX';" errors
Plugins with broken "project-operation" modules can prevent other modules project-operations from being loaded

fields.description: If there are two custom fields with the same name, but only one custom is field is visible to the user, the query validation will fail, if the user tries to search for issues with this custom field.
fields.summary: JQL query fails validation even the field name and value are explicit from the user point of view

fields.description:
A Filter should be able to have a specific Issue Navigator (view) i.e. it should only show the columns that are relevant to that filter. 

At the moment Jira 3.13.4 has can only have one Issue Navigator (view) per user and not per defined Filter... this makes the Filters almost completely useless because you can filter the issues you are interested in but not the information you want.
[http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.13.4/navigatorcolumns.html]

Unless there is a work around?
fields.summary: Multiple Issue Nagivators (on a per Filter basis not per user)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17861].
  {panel}

I'll explain this with a use case....

I need to get our developers to submit a 'Status Report' on a particular issue type (normally once a week). I've created a workflow transition called 'Report Status' which brings up a reporting screen (works well). The 'Status Report' is a free text custom field. Whenever they update the 'Status Report' via the transition+screen I would like to set a custom date field called 'Status Report Date' to $TODAY$.

This will record when the last 'Status Report' was submitted.

Thanks.

p.s. sorry if this is a duplicate.

ALTERNATIVELY.....
I can't validate that they have updated 'Status Report Date'==TODAY manually either.
fields.summary: Workflow Transition Post Function - Assign a custom date field TODAY
Cleanup tasks for OAuth SPI (Part II)

fields.description:
I know my feature request is related to CRUC-114  - but is there some way to make this a native feature of Jira? 

We've implemented a ticketing system workflow into our jira and I've been told to include expirations and notifications into it.

EG: Truck has safety inspection. expiration date is entered into JIRA. 3 months before actual expiration, notice is sent to fleet mech. & purchasing for scheduling and requisitioning, respectively.  

I've just about got it all done the way we want, EXCEPT for the expiration notices. I thought to use a listener, but do not have the resources to go and create the (plugin?) code for it.

Assistance from ?? would be great - but this would also be a great feature for JIRA.
fields.summary: Expiration date & notice feature

fields.description:
Each company using Jira faces the problem from time to time: a user goes to vacation or goes sick, so some other person should process all issues where the absent user is assignee. Currently the only option is to find and process such issues by hand, re-assign them if necessary, change other custom fields, where the absent user is mentioned. It's not convenient.

I suggest Jira provides a way to assign a substitute for any user. For example, in the Users list there should be a field *Current substitute*, and if it is filled in, the given user is used anywhere in the algorithms (including plugins' in/out parameters) instead of the original one.
fields.summary: CLONE -There should be a way for setting a substitute for a given assignee (user)

fields.description:
There are a number of differences when when using Firefox and Internet Explorer to view pages in 4.0 Beta1.

For some reason the "Title" (Administration->General Configuration->Settings->Title) does not show up on the home page or the login page with Firefox.  It does with IE.

I found JRA-17754 which discusses the odd behavior with frames that pop-up and go away in Firefox (but not IE).
That issue does not mention the problem of those frames appearing on the login page before you even login.
You should not see the "Projects", "Favorite Filters", etc. gadgets on the login page.

I don't fully understand the explanation of how the new gadgets are going to fix the odd behavior on the home dashboard.
In Beta1, there is a lot of wasted space surrounding the gadgets -- I hope that will be resolved too.  Is there a newer
release of the Beta that might show some improvements there?

Thanks.
fields.summary: Title missing on home page and login page when using Firefox
Upgrade to atlassian wiki renderer 5.0 or newer

fields.description: See screenshot.  I think we may have to change the height using javascript, once all the content's been loaded.
fields.summary: Browse project page doesn't resize vertical when content is loaded in IE6

fields.description:
Steps:.
1. Login to JIRA as admin.
2. Create a project and upload the attached png file as avatar.

Result:
1. JIRA throw stack trace and during the blitz test, the team was unable to access JIRA
2. In UI there is system error message.

Expected:
1. The handing should be better. There should be a proper error message displayed if file is not proper.
fields.summary: project Avatar:Trying to upload this PNG file as project avatar give stack trace.

fields.description:
Problem:

Click on a column to sort results
Sorting information will appended to the JQL Query.
Sorting information stays every time you run the query, even when not in the JQL Query specified.
fields.summary: Can't reset sorting in Issue Navigator when using JQL

fields.description:
When creating a sub-task the sub task component(s) should automatically default to the parent task's components (rather than 'none').

p.s. you don't have a Component == 'Component' on THIS Jira project :)
fields.summary: Sub Task Should Inherit Parent's Component

fields.description:
In order to prevent DOS attacks on a JIRA instance, by creating a dashboard with 100s of gadgets and reloading the page, JIRA 4.0 will impose a limit on the number of gadgets users can add to a dashboard.  If they try to exceed this limit they will get the following error message in a popup:
{quote}
Sorry, you have exceeded the maximum number of gadgets supported by your Dashboard.  You must remove some gadgets before proceeding.
{quote}

By default, you're only allowed to have 20 gadgets per dashboard.

We should document that if admins *really* want to raise this limit, then they can edit the 'jira.dashboard.max.gadgets=20' jira-application.properties property, to a value that suits them (and restart JIRA).

On a side note: Old dashboards (from data prior to JIRA 4.0) that already have more gagdets on them than this limit, will still be displayed for backwards compatibility.  The error message above will only be shown if the user tries to add yet another gadget to this dashboard.
fields.summary: Document maxium number of gadgets per dashboard limitation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17850].
  {panel}

fields.description:
It's waste of printer toner. :(

See screenshot attached -
* dark gray background printed when Pie Chart or Calendar does not fit page
* light gray printed at the end of the last page

NOTE: Tested IE 8.0 - does not print dark grey but prints light gray at the end.
fields.summary: Do not print gray background when printing dashboard from FireFox

fields.description:
Today the power failed, and when the init script tried to start JIRA 4.0b1, it only got as far as the error:

  The jira.home directory '/var/lib/jira/4.0b1/data' is already locked by another JIRA instance.

I imagine that tripping over stale lockfiles like this will become a big problem, as any unclean JIRA shutdown then requires manual intervention to fix. Small outages become large ones.

Perhaps we could have a background thread running every 30 secs that calls File.setLastModified(), and if JIRA encounters a file > 30 seconds old, considers it stale and ignores it?
fields.summary: JIRA lockfile left after unclean shutdowns, prevents startup
Wiki Renderer color tag doesn't work around bullets, numbers, or tables.

fields.description:
# Create a custom field {{custom_field1}} and expose it to issue types A, B; but *not* C,D
# Create some issues of issue type A and C
# Configure your issue navigator to show the column {{custom_field1}}
# Select the *Any* value from the issue type list.  Observe that {{custom_field1}} does not appear.
# Select issue type A only and observe {{custom_field1}} appears
# Multiple select A,B,C,D and notice {{custom_field1}} appears
# Select A and C and notice {{custom_field1}} appears

The questionable behaviour is:
* Why does the behaviour change when selecting *Any* vs. the whole set of issue types (A,B,C,D) ?
* Why does the column show if selecting A and C?
fields.summary: Inconsistent Issue Navigator behaviour of Column Renderings in relation to Custom Field Contexts

fields.description: If you have a filter in your session and the filter gets deleted the user is presented with a confusing error message while on the view issue page. See attached screenshot. We should probably hide this message on the view issue page.
fields.summary: spurious error message on view issue page when non-existent filter is found in session

fields.description:
*Steps to replicate:*
1. Use JIRA with the default  value for jira.projectkey.pattern ( _jira.projectkey.pattern= ([A-Z][A-Z]+)_ ).
2. In Step 1 of the Fogbugz importer  ( _Project Key Mappings (Step 1 of 6)_ ) specify an alphanumeric project key in _Target project key_ for eg. ADMIN1
3. Complete the import process.
4. Navigate to Projects from the JIRA admin interface - new project is listed there.

*Warning*

If a user navigates to any of the imported issues, JIRA returns the following error:

{quote}
ERROR
The project you are trying to view does not exist. Try browsing for projects.
If you think this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions. 
{quote}

That is due to the fact that the project key doesn't match the pattern from jira.projectkey.pattern and user have just come across a different bug related to the project pattern from from [JRA-15856|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-15856].

*Possible workaround*
Modify your jira.projectkey.pattern from /WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties to suite your project key patten for e.g to allow alphanumeric project keys patten should be ([A-Z][A-Z0-9]+)
fields.summary: Fogbugz importer doesn't respect project key pattern

fields.description:
Steps: 

# Create issue TST-1 and set the number custom field to -2
# Create issue TST-2 and set the number custom field to -1
# Create issue TST-3 and set the number custom field to 0
# In the issue navigator search for values {{between -2 and 0}}

Result: 

The issues where the values are -2 and 0 are returned - TST-1 and TST-3

Expected result:

All issues with the value in the range -2 to 0 inclusive are found.

NOTE: JQL in 4.0 Beta 1 has the same bug e.g

{code}Numbers >= -2 AND Numbers <= 0{code}

WIll return the same incorrect results
fields.summary: Number Range Searcher doesn't work for negative ranges.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a saved filter with an error that can be displayed in simple mode (e.g. create a filter {{assignee in membersOf(group)}}, save it, then delete {{group}})
# Clear the saved filter from your session
# Go into Advanced editing mode
# Load the saved filter from before

Since the errors of the filter can be displayed in Simple mode, the view displayed will be Simple mode, despite the fact that you explicitly set your session to be in Advanced mode.
Also, despite the view being in Simple mode, the switching link at the top of the filter form still says "Switch to simple mode", because your session still thinks you are in Advanced mode.

I think the fix here is to either:
* Don't flick the user back to Simple mode to display simple errors if they are in advanced mode, or
* If you are going to flick them, reset their session to be Simple mode as well
fields.summary: Simple/Advanced editing state of Issue Navigator is invalidated when loading a saved filter with errors that can fit in Simple editing mode

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Click on "Administration" tab. Click "Add project" link. Or try opening dialog by editing any project.
3. Click on default project avatar to launch project avatar dialog.

Result.
1. Nothing happens. User can just see the spinning image.
2. Its working on Safari 4.0

Expected:
1. The project avatar dialog should get launch and user is able to work.
fields.summary: project Avatar:Project avatar is not working on Safari 3

fields.description:
There is a race condition in the {{DefaultConstantsManager.getStatusObjectsMap()}} (and potentially elsewhere) where the method calls {{initStatuses()}} that checks whether the {{statusObjectsMap}} field is null or not and if so initialises it. After returning {{getStatusObjectsMap()}} returns the value of the {{statusObjectsMap}} field.

The problem is, if someone calls {{refresh()}} just after the null check in {{initStatuses()}} and before the read of the field in the outer method, then {{getStatusObjectsMap()}} will return null. Other methods presume that this method never returns null so a {{NullPointerException}} is thrown.

The map should be replaced by a {{LazyReference}} that self initialises.

This is most likely to happen during a Data Import as that is where {{refresh()}} may be called concurrently while other threads are accessing it. This has been seen in our functional tests.
 
Stacktrace:

fields.summary: Race condition in DefaultConstantsManager.getStatusObjects()

fields.description: I'm using Jira 4.0 to manage a project and wanted to get a good idea of how many issues I have in each component.  So, I clicked on the Components tab under Browse Project but there is no way to see this.  Could we possibly add the number of open issues with this component in this listing?
fields.summary: Under Browse Project --> Components, put number of issues per component.
Movie Issue Operation is tied to browsing session - unexpected behavior when using multiple browser tabs

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login JIRA. Click on "Administration" tab.
2. Click on "Add Project" and try uploading a file having unsupported character in filename like *,?,<>,/ etc.

Result.
1. Currently we give error message "The filename you have uploaded contains illegal characters. Please rename it and try again."

Expected:
1. It will be great if error message list the invalid characters, so that user can edit and load the file.
fields.summary: Project Avatar: Error message for illegal filename for project avatar should list the invalid characters also

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. To reproduce the issue, just have any png,gif or jpg file and delete its extension.
3. Click on "Administration" tab. Click "Add Project"
4. Try uploading the valid image file without extension as custom avatar. Try this on both IE 7.0 and FF 3.0

Result 
1. On IE 7.0 the files get uploaded without any error message and user can set as project avatar.
2. On Firefox user get "Invalid file error message....."

Expected:
1. The behavior should be same across all browser.
fields.summary: project Avatar:Trying to upload a valid image file having no extension, show different behavior in different browser.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Launch JIRA.
2. Login to JIRA and click "Administration" tab.
3. Click "Add project". 
4. Try to upload a invalid file/file name having invalid characters as custom avatar by clicking the "upload image" button. 

Result:
1. Sometime it keep user showing the spinning image. User thought that system is performing task, but actually user can click anywhere and even can upload another image.
2. Files are placed at \\filehost\scratch\6months\vbharara\JRA-17828

Expected:
1. Error handing should be proper and user should get proper error message.
fields.summary: project Avatar:Error handing is not fool proof on IE 7.0
